availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer. Maryland native. Married to Permelia Stevenson Carrington. Father to William F. Carrington, Margaret Carrington, James Carrington, John H. Carrington, Strother Carrington, Samuel Carrington, Elizabeth Carrington, Dermetia A. Carrington, Eliza Carrington, Taylor Carrington, and Benjamin F. Carrington. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Owned Peter [Unknown] in Montgomery County in 1857. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860.
